# kendo.dataviz.ui.Chart

## Configuration

### autoBind `Boolean` *(default: true)*

If set to `false` the widget will not bind to the data source during initialization. In this case data binding will occur when the [change](/api/javascript/data/datasource/events/change) event of the
data source is fired. By default the widget will bind to the data source specified in the configuration.

> Setting `autoBind` to `false` is useful when multiple widgets are bound to the same data source. Disabling automatic binding ensures that the shared data source doesn't make more than one request to the remote service.


<div class="meta-api-description">
Control whether the chart fetches or binds data automatically on initialization by enabling or disabling automatic data loading, deferring data requests until explicitly triggered or when the data source changes; configure delayed or manual binding to prevent immediate remote calls, manage shared data sources across multiple charts without redundant network requests, and set initialization behavior to optimize data fetching, synchronization, and resource usage during chart setup or dynamic updates.
</div>

#### Example - disable automatic binding

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
    var dataSource = new kendo.data.DataSource({
      transport: {
        read: {
          url: "https://demos.telerik.com/service/v2/core/stockdata",
          contentType: "application/json"
        }
      }
    });
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      autoBind: false,
      dataSource: dataSource,
      series: [
        { field: "Volume" }
      ]
    });
    dataSource.read(); // "read()" will fire the "change" event of the dataSource and the widget will be bound
    </script>

### axisDefaults `Object`

The default options for all chart axes. Accepts the options supported by [categoryAxis](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-categoryAxis), [valueAxis](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-valueAxis), [xAxis](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-xAxis) and [yAxis](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-yAxis).


<div class="meta-api-description">
Set shared default configurations for chart axes to control common properties like scale type, label formatting, styling, tick settings, and axis behaviors applicable universally across all axes unless individually overridden. Configure consistent axis appearance, including categories, values, X or Y orientations, and common label or gridline options to maintain uniform axis presentation in charts. Enable or customize default axis options such as scaling, labels, ticks, gridlines, and styles to streamline axis setup without repeating settings for each axis. Apply global axis rules for categories, values, or dimensional axes with defaults that standardize the look and function of every axis in a chart visualization. Manage axis defaults to define baseline axis settings, controlling common features like labels, ranges, scales, and styling shared by all axes.
</div>

#### Example - set the default axis options

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      axisDefaults: {
        categories: [ "2012", "2013"]
      },
      series: [
        { data: [1, 2, 3] }
      ]
    });
    </script>

### axisDefaults.background `String`

The background color of the axis.


<div class="meta-api-description">
Set or customize the fill color behind chart axes to enhance visual contrast, styling, theming, readability, or background appearance by applying CSS-compatible color values such as hex codes, RGB values, color names, or CSS color strings to all chart axes simultaneously; configure default axis background colors for consistent look and feel, control axis area shading for charts, and enable easy theming adjustments or contrast improvements through global axis background color settings.
</div>

#### Example - set the axisDefaults background

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      axisDefaults: {
        background: "lightblue"
      },
      series: [
        { data: [1, 2, 3] }
      ]
    });
    </script>

### axisDefaults.color `String`

The color to apply to all axis elements. Accepts a valid CSS color string, including hex and rgb.


<div class="meta-api-description">
Control and customize the default color applied uniformly across all chart axis elements such as labels, grid lines, ticks, and borders by specifying any valid CSS color format including hexadecimal codes, RGB, RGBA, HSL, or named CSS colors. Configure and set the axis color during chart initialization to ensure consistent styling and theming for axis components, enabling easy adjustment of visual appearance for axis text, tick marks, and axis lines. Use this setting to adjust or override default axis colors, harmonize chart visual themes, highlight axis features, or create contrast with chart backgrounds and data series.
</div>

#### Example - set the axisDefaults color

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      axisDefaults: {
        color: "red"
      },
      series: [
        { data: [1, 2, 3] }
      ]
    });
    </script>

### axisDefaults.crosshair `Object`

The crosshair configuration options.

> The crosshair is displayed when the [axisDefaults.crosshair.visible](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-axisDefaults.crosshair.visible) option is set to `true`.


<div class="meta-api-description">
Set up and customize the axis crosshair appearance and behavior by controlling visibility, line style, color, width, dash type, opacity, and interaction settings like snapping, tooltip display, or crosshair movement on the chart axis. Adjust properties to enable or disable the crosshair, modify its look for precise data tracking, control how it responds to user input and hover, and tailor visual cues for better chart readability and navigation across all axes by default. This includes configuring default crosshair settings that affect line aesthetics and interactive features for consistent and intuitive data exploration on charts.
</div>

#### Example - set the default crosshair configuration options

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      axisDefaults: {
        crosshair: {
          color: "green",
          width: 2,
          zIndex:1,
          visible: true
        }
      },
      series: [
        { type: "column", data: [[1, 2], [3, 4], [4, 5]] }
      ]
    });
    </script>

### axisDefaults.crosshair.color `String`

The color of the crosshair. Accepts a valid CSS color string, including hex and rgb.


<div class="meta-api-description">

### axisDefaults.crosshair.dashType `String` *(default: "solid")*

The dash type of the crosshair.

The following dash types are supported:

* "dash" - a line consisting of dashes
* "dashDot" - a line consisting of a repeating pattern of dash-dot
* "dot" - a line consisting of dots
* "longDash" - a line consisting of a repeating pattern of long-dash
* "longDashDot" - a line consisting of a repeating pattern of long-dash-dot
* "longDashDotDot" - a line consisting of a repeating pattern of long-dash-dot-dot
* "solid" - a solid line


<div class="meta-api-description">
Configure and customize the crosshair line style by setting patterns such as solid, dashed, dotted, dash-dot, long dash, long dash-dot, and long dash-dot-dot to control the stroke appearance, enabling developers to style, enable, or change the crosshair line visualization with various dash and dot combinations for enhanced chart interactivity and visual clarity in data presentations or analytic views.
</div>

#### Example - set the axisDefaults crosshair dashType

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      axisDefaults: {
        crosshair: {
          dashType: "dash",
          visible: true
        }
      },
      series: [
        { data: [1, 2, 3] }
      ]
    });
    </script>

### axisDefaults.crosshair.opacity `Number` *(default: 1)*

The opacity of the crosshair. By default the crosshair is opaque.


<div class="meta-api-description">
Adjust and configure the transparency, alpha level, or opacity of the chart’s hover crosshair line to highlight or soften the guideline visibility during mouseover or pointer hover interactions, enabling control over how solid or translucent the crosshair appears for better focus or subtlety in data visualization. This setting helps customize the crosshair’s see-through effect, allowing developers to set fade, transparency, or blending levels to emphasize or de-emphasize the interactive guideline displayed on charts when users hover over data points or axes.
</div>

#### Example - set the axisDefaults crosshair opacity

A function that can be used to create a custom visual for the labels. The available argument fields are:

* dataItem - the data item, in case a field has been specified

* options - the label options.

* sender - the chart instance (may be undefined).
* text - the label text.
* value - the category value


<div class="meta-api-description">

#### Example - using custom visual for axisDefaults labels

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      axisDefaults: {
        labels: {
          visual: function(e) {
            var rect = new kendo.geometry.Rect(e.rect.origin, [e.rect.size.width, e.rect.size.height]);
            var layout = new kendo.drawing.Layout(rect, {
              orientation: "vertical",
              alignContent: "center"
            });
            var text = new kendo.drawing.Text(e.text, e.rect.center(), {

          }
        }

    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      axisDefaults: {
        title: {
          text: "Axis Title",
          visual: function(e) {
            var rect = new kendo.geometry.Rect(e.rect.origin, [e.rect.size.width, e.rect.size.height]);
            var layout = new kendo.drawing.Layout(rect, {
              orientation: "vertical",
              alignContent: "center"
            });
            var text = new kendo.drawing.Text(e.text, e.rect.center(), {
              fill: {

              }
            });

### categoryAxis.autoBaseUnitSteps `Object`

The discrete [categoryAxis.baseUnitStep](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-categoryAxis.baseUnitStep) values when
either [categoryAxis.baseUnit](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-categoryAxis.baseUnit) is set to "fit" or
[categoryAxis.baseUnitStep](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-categoryAxis.baseUnitStep) is set to "auto".

The axis will try to divide the active period into successively larger intervals.
It will start from x-second intervals, where x is picked from the autoBaseUnitSteps.seconds array.

Category index at which the first value axis crosses this axis (when set as an object).

<div class="meta-api-description">
Adjust or configure the position where value axes intersect or cross the horizontal or category axis on a chart by setting specific category indices, enabling precise alignment or offset of multiple value axes relative to categories, including specifying single or multiple crossing points with indexes representing exact category positions or beyond to denote edges; manage crossings across different panes by assigning placeholder or exact crossing indexes per pane to coordinate axis overlays and improve chart readability, facilitating axis positioning control for scenarios like shifting axis intersections, aligning multiple value axes in multi-pane charts, offsetting axis crossing to highlight data segments, or customizing axis layout for complex chart configurations.

    <script>
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      categoryAxis: {
        categories: [ "2012", "2013"],
        axisCrossingValue: [0, 2]
      },
      valueAxis: [{}, {}],
      series: [
        { data: [1, 2, 3] }
      ]
    });

        ],
        valueAxis: [
          { pane: "top-pane" },
          { pane: "bottom-pane", name: "bottom-1" },
          { pane: "bottom-pane", name: "bottom-2" }

        panes: [

        ],
        categoryAxis: [{

### categoryAxis.baseUnit `String`

The base time interval for the date axis. The default base unit is determined automatically from the minimum difference
between subsequent categories.

The supported values are:

* "fit"
* "milliseconds"
* "seconds"
* "minutes"
* "hours"
* "days"
* "weeks"
* "months"
* "years"

Setting `baseUnit` to "fit" will set such base unit and [categoryAxis.baseUnitStep](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-categoryAxis.baseUnitStep)
that the total number of categories does not exceed [categoryAxis.maxDateGroups](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-categoryAxis.maxDateGroups).

Series data is aggregated for the specified base unit using the [series.aggregate](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-series.aggregate) function.


<div class="meta-api-description">
Control the time interval granularity, time grouping, or time unit of a chart’s date axis by configuring the base time step or base period used to group or bucket categories and aggregate data points over intervals like milliseconds, seconds, minutes, hours, days, weeks, months, or years. Adjust or set the time grouping, time aggregation unit, or date axis resolution to customize how series data is grouped and visualized across varying time scales and zoom levels, including automatic fitting options that optimize date groups based on data density and maximum group counts, enabling flexible control of temporal data granularity and aggregation windows on time-based chart axes.
</div>

#### Example - set the categoryAxis baseUnit

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      categoryAxis: {
        categories: [
          new Date("2012/02/01"),
          new Date("2012/02/02"),
          new Date("2012/02/03")
        ],
        baseUnit: "days"
      },
      series: [
        { data: [1, 2, 3] }
      ]
    });
    </script>

### categoryAxis.labels.visual `Function`

A function that can be used to create a custom visual for the labels. The available argument fields are:

* createVisual - a function that can be used to get the default visual.
* culture - the default culture (if set) on the label
* dataItem - the data item, in case a field has been specified
* format - the default format of the label
* options - the label options.
* rect - the `kendo.geometry.Rect` that defines where the visual should be rendered.
* sender - the chart instance (may be undefined).
* text - the label text.
* value - the category value


<div class="meta-api-description">
Customize category axis labels in charts by configuring or overriding their visual appearance with personalized rendering functions that can leverage default visuals, cultural formatting, label text, underlying data values, label metadata, and rendering geometry. This enables control over label styling, formatting, localization, position, text content, and access to chart instances for dynamic or data-driven label presentation, supporting scenarios like custom fonts, colors, shapes, or complex visual elements for axis labels based on category values and associated data fields in chart visualizations.
</div>

#### Example - using custom visual for the labels

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
      $("#chart").kendoChart({
        categoryAxis: {
          categories: ["foo bar"],
          labels: {
            visual: function(e) {
              var rect = new kendo.geometry.Rect(e.rect.origin, [e.rect.size.width, 100]);
              var layout = new kendo.drawing.Layout(rect, {
                orientation: "vertical",
                alignContent: "center"
              });
              var words = e.text.split(" ");
              for (var i = 0; i < words.length; i++) {
                layout.append(new kendo.drawing.Text(words[i]));
              }
              layout.reflow();
              return layout;
            }
          }
        },
        series: [{
          data: [1]
        }]
      });
    </script>

<div class="meta-api-description">
Control and customize the rendering of category axis plot band labels by providing a custom visual function that returns a tailored visual element, enabling modification or replacement of default label rendering on charts. This customization supports access to label text, bounding rectangle geometry, chart instance, label options, and a method to generate the default visual, allowing developers to configure and set unique visuals, override or enhance label appearance, and fine-tune positioning and styling in category axis plot bands for data visualization. </div>

#### Example - set the categoryAxis plotBands label visual

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      categoryAxis: {
        categories: ["Jan", "Feb", "Mar"],
        plotBands: [{
          from: 0.5,
          to: 1.5,
          color: "lightblue",
          label: {
            text: "Band Label",
            visual: (e) => {
              var rect = new kendo.geometry.Rect(e.rect.origin, [60, 20]);
              var path = kendo.drawing.Path.fromRect(rect, {
                fill: {
                  color: "red"
                },
                stroke: {
                  color: "black"
                }
              });
              var text = new kendo.drawing.Text(e.text, [e.rect.origin.x + 5, e.rect.origin.y + 5], {
                fill: {
                  color: "white"
                }
              });
              var group = new kendo.drawing.Group();
              group.append(path, text);
              return group;
            }
          }
        }]
      },
      series: [
        { data: [1, 2, 3] }
      ]
    });

### categoryAxis.rangeLabels.visual `Function`

A function that can be used to create a custom visual for the date range labels. The available argument fields are:

* createVisual - a function that can be used to get the default visual.
* culture - the default culture (if set) on the label
* dataItem - the data item, in case a field has been specified
* format - the default format of the label
* options - the label options.
* rect - the `kendo.geometry.Rect` that defines where the visual should be rendered.
* sender - the chart instance (may be undefined).
* text - the label text.
* value - the category value


<div class="meta-api-description">
Control and customize how date range labels appear on the category axis of a chart by setting a function to replace or enhance the default label visuals, enabling tailored text rendering, layout adjustments, custom drawings, or formatting overrides. This approach supports configuring label appearance with access to localization settings, default formatting, label data content, rendering boundaries, and chart context, useful for changing styles dynamically, localizing date ranges, applying custom graphics or fonts, or injecting additional data-driven content for timeline or category axes in time-series charts. Customize label text, layout position, cultural formatting, and draw visuals programmatically for better presentation and interaction with axis labels.
</div>

#### Example - using custom visual for the labels

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      categoryAxis: {
        type: "date",
        justified: true,
        baseUnit: "days",
        rangeLabels: {
            format: 'dd-MMM',
            visible: true,
            visual: function(e) {
                var rect = new kendo.geometry.Rect(e.rect.origin, [e.rect.size.width, 100]);
                var layout = new kendo.drawing.Layout(rect, {
                    orientation: "vertical",
                    alignContent: "center"
                });
                var words = e.text.split("-");
                for (var i = 0; i < words.length; i++) {
                    layout.append(new kendo.drawing.Text(words[i]));
                }
                layout.reflow();
                return layout;
            }
        },
        labels: {
          format: "M-d"
        }
      },
      series: [{
        type: 'line',
        field: 'value',
        categoryField: 'date',
        data: [{
          value: 1,
          date: new Date("2012/01/01")
        }, {
          value: 2,
          date: new Date("2012/01/04")
        }, {
          value: 3,
          date: new Date("2012/01/07")
        }]
      }]
    });
    </script>

            text: "foo bar",
            visual: function (e) {
              var layout = new kendo.drawing.Layout(e.rect, {
                orientation: "vertical",
                alignContent: "center",
                justifyContent: "end"
              });
              var words = e.text.split(" ");
              for (var i = 0; i < words.length; i++) {
                layout.append(new kendo.drawing.Text(words[i]));
              }
              layout.reflow();
              return layout;
            }
          },
          categories: ["2012", "2013"]

        series: [
          { data: [1, 2, 3] }
        ]
      });

### categoryAxis.notes.visual `Function`

A function that can be used to create a custom visual for the notes. The available argument fields are:

* rect - the `kendo.geometry.Rect` that defines the note target rect.
* options - the note options.
* createVisual - a function that can be used to get the default visual.
* value - the note value.


<div class="meta-api-description">

</div>

#### Example - use custom visual for the notes

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
      $("#chart").kendoChart({
        series: [{
          data: [1, 2, 3]
        }],
        categoryAxis: {
          notes: {
            data: [{
              value: 1
            }],
            visual: function (e) {
              var targetPoint = { x: e.rect.center().x, y: e.rect.origin.y };
              var line = new kendo.drawing.Path()
              .moveTo(targetPoint.x, targetPoint.y)
              .lineTo(targetPoint.x, targetPoint.y - 10);
              var circle = new kendo.drawing.Circle(new kendo.geometry.Circle([targetPoint.x, targetPoint.y - 30], 20), {
                fill: {
                  color: "red"
                }
              });

              return new kendo.drawing.Group({
                zIndex: 1
              }).append(line, circle);
            }
          }
        }
      });
    </script>

<div class="meta-api-description">

#### Example - using custom visual for the legend items

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
      $("#chart").kendoChart({
        legend: {
          item: {
            visual: function (e) {
              var color = e.options.markers.background;
              var labelColor = e.options.labels.color;
              var rect = new kendo.geometry.Rect([0, 0], [100, 50]);
              var layout = new kendo.drawing.Layout(rect, {
                spacing: 5,
                alignItems: "center"
              });

              var marker = new kendo.drawing.Path({
                fill: {
                  color: color
                }
              }).moveTo(10, 0).lineTo(15, 10).lineTo(5, 10).close();

              var label = new kendo.drawing.Text(e.series.name, [0, 0], {
                fill: {
                  color: labelColor
                }
              });

              layout.append(marker, label);
              layout.reflow()

              return layout;
            }
          }
        },
        series: [
          { name: "Series 1", data: [1, 2, 3] },
          { name: "Series 2", data: [3, 4, 5] }

### legend.labels.template `String|Function`

The [template](/api/javascript/kendo/methods/template) which renders the labels.

The fields which can be used in the template are:

*   text - the text the legend item.
*   series - the data series.
*   value - the point value. (only for donut and pie charts)
*   percentage - the point value represented as a percentage value. Available only for donut, pie and 100% stacked charts.

> The text can be split into multiple lines by using line feed characters ("\n").


<div class="meta-api-description">
Customize and control the appearance and content of chart legend labels by defining templates that can format or rewrite the label text, reference data series names, display values or percentages for pie, donut, and 100% stacked charts, and enable multi-line label layouts using newline characters, allowing flexible configuration of legend item presentation, dynamic insertion of data fields, fine-tuning of label text display, and tailored visualization of chart legends across different chart types.
</div>

    <script>

### paneDefaults.title.visual `Function`

A function that can be used to create a custom visual for the title. The available argument fields are:

* text - the label text.
* rect - the `kendo.geometry.Rect` that defines where the visual should be rendered.
* sender - the chart instance (may be undefined).


<div class="meta-api-description">
Customize or override the chart title display by supplying a function that generates a personalized title graphic or layout, enabling developers to render dynamic, styled, or uniquely positioned labels based on the given text content and the designated drawing area, while accessing chart instance context for advanced customization; supports scenarios like programmatic title rendering, modifying default label appearance, setting custom shapes or fonts for the title, controlling title placement within charts, and creating interactive or visually enhanced header elements.
</div>

#### Example - set the default pane title visual

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      series: [
        { data: [1, 2, 3] },
        { data: [1, 2, 3, 4], axis: "bottom" }
      ],
      valueAxis: [
        { pane: "top-pane" },
        { pane: "bottom-pane", name: "bottom" }
      ],
      paneDefaults: {
        title: {
          visual: function(e) {
            var rect = new kendo.geometry.Rect(e.rect.origin, [200, 30]);
            var layout = new kendo.drawing.Layout(rect, {
              spacing: 5,
              alignItems: "center"
            });
            var text = new kendo.drawing.Text(e.text, [0, 0], {
              fill: {
                color: "red"
              }
            });
            layout.append(text);
            return layout;
          }
        }
      },
      panes: [
        { name: "top-pane",
          title: {
            text: "Top"
          }
        },
        { name: "bottom-pane",
          title: {
            text: "Bottom"
          }
        }
      ]
    });
    </script>
* options - the label options.
* createVisual - a function that can be used to get the default visual.

### panes `Array`

The chart panes configuration.

Panes are used to split the chart in two or more parts. The panes are ordered from top to bottom.

Each axis can be associated with a pane by setting its `pane` option to the name of the desired pane.
Axis that don't have specified pane are placed in the top (default) pane.

Series are moved to the desired pane by associating them with an axis.


<div class="meta-api-description">
Configure multiple stacked panels within a chart to display distinct axes and data series separately by splitting the chart area into several named panes arranged vertically from top to bottom. Set up different chart sections or segments where specific axes and their linked series can be assigned, enabling control over which data appears in which panel or subsection. Customize layout by defining pane names and ordering, and link series to these panes either directly or through axes associated with a particular pane name, facilitating visualization of multiple datasets or coordinate systems within a single chart container. Adjust panel assignments, organize axes per pane, and control multi-pane chart segmentation for enhanced data comparison and clarity.
</div>

#### Example - configure the chart panes
    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      series: [
        { data: [1, 2, 3] },
        { data: [1, 2, 3, 4], axis: "bottom" }
      ],
      valueAxis: [
        { pane: "top-pane" },
        { pane: "bottom-pane", name: "bottom" }
      ],
      panes: [
        { name: "top-pane" },
        { name: "bottom-pane" }
      ]
    });
    </script>

<div class="meta-api-description">

#### Example - using custom visual for the title

        series: [
          { data: [1, 2, 3] }
        ],

            text: "foo bar",
            visual: function (e) {
              var layout = new kendo.drawing.Layout(e.rect, {
                orientation: "vertical",
                alignContent: "center"
              });
              var words = e.text.split(" ");
              for (var i = 0; i < words.length; i++) {

### pdf.proxyURL `String` *(default: null)*
The URL of the server side proxy which will stream the file to the end user.

A proxy will be used when the browser isn't capable of saving files locally.
Such browsers are IE version 9 and lower and Safari.

The developer is responsible for implementing the server-side proxy.

The proxy will receive a POST request with the following parameters in the request body:

* contentType: The MIME type of the file
* base64: The base-64 encoded file content
* fileName: The file name, as requested by the caller.

The proxy should return the decoded file with set "Content-Disposition" header.


<div class="meta-api-description">
Configure server-side proxy URL to enable file downloads of generated PDFs in Chart components on browsers lacking direct local file saving support, such as IE 9 and below or Safari, by routing base64-encoded MIME-typed content and filenames via POST requests to a backend endpoint that decodes and streams the file with appropriate content-disposition headers; this setup allows control over PDF export workflows, fallback mechanisms for legacy browser compatibility, enabling download on restricted environments, and custom proxy implementation to handle secure, seamless file delivery from client to user.
</div>

#### Example - set the server proxy URL
    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
      $("#chart").kendoChart({
          pdf: {
              proxyURL: "/save"
          },
          legend: {
              position: "bottom"
          },
          series: [
              { name: "Series 1", data: [1, 2, 3] },
              { name: "Series 2", data: [3, 4, 5] }
          ]
      });

      var chart = $("#chart").getKendoChart();
      chart.saveAsPDF();
    </script>

### renderAs `String`

Sets the preferred rendering engine.
If it is not supported by the browser, the Chart will switch to the first available mode.

The supported values are:

* "svg" - renders the widget as inline SVG document, if available
* "canvas" - renders the widget as a Canvas element, if available.


<div class="meta-api-description">
Choose or configure how a chart or graph is rendered visually by setting the rendering engine to either inline SVG or Canvas elements, enabling control over the drawing method for better compatibility or performance; use this to switch between vector-based scalable graphics or raster-based canvas rendering, with automatic fallback if the browser does not support the preferred mode, suitable for optimizing rendering quality, graphics fidelity, browser compatibility, or hardware acceleration in data visualization components.
</div>

#### Example - Render as Canvas, if supported

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
        $("#chart").kendoChart({
            renderAs: "canvas",
            series: [{
                type: "pie",
                data: [1, 2]
            }],
            categoryAxis: {
                categories: ["Foo", "Bar"]
            }
        });
    </script>

### series `Array`

The configuration of the chart series.

The series type is determined by the value of the type field.
If a type value is missing, the type is assumed to be the one specified in seriesDefaults.

> Some options accept function as argument. They will be evaluated for each point (supplied as parameter). The theme/seriesDefaults value will be used if no value is returned.


<div class="meta-api-description">
Control and customize multiple chart data series by specifying series bindings, selecting or overriding series types such as line, bar, or scatter, and configuring individual series styling and data field mappings. Enable per-series settings that support dynamic value functions evaluated at each data point to customize appearance or behavior, with fallbacks to default global settings when specific options are omitted. Manage how each series renders within the chart, including assigning series types, applying conditional formatting or styles, binding distinct datasets to different series, and overriding default series configurations for precise, flexible multi-series visualization.
</div>

#### Example - configure the chart series

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      series: [
        { type: "line", data: [1, 2, 3] },
        { type: "bar", data: [4, 5, 6] }
      ]
    });
    </script>

### series.aggregate `String|Function` *(default: "max")*

The aggregate function to apply for date series.

This function is used when a category (an year, month, etc.) contains two or more points.


<div class="meta-api-description">
Configure how multiple data points within the same time interval or category—such as year, month, or day—are combined or summarized in a data series using aggregation functions like sum, average, count, or other statistical methods. Enable rolling up or grouping of time-based data points to consolidate series values, control summarization for charts with overlapping timestamps, and customize how numerical data across grouped intervals is calculated or merged for visualization and analysis. Adjust aggregation settings to manage time series data consolidation, ensuring accurate representation of repeated or grouped date-based measurements.
</div>

#### Example - set the series aggregate

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      series: [{
        type: "line",
        aggregate: "avg",
        data: [
          { date: new Date("2012/01/01"), value: 1 },
          { date: new Date("2012/01/01"), value: 3 },
          { date: new Date("2012/01/02"), value: 2 }
        ]
      }],
      categoryAxis: {
        type: "date",
        field: "date"
      },
      valueAxis: {
        field: "value"
      }
    });
    </script>
The function return value is displayed instead of the individual points.

The supported values are:

* "avg" - the average of all values for the date period.
* "count" - the number of values for the date period.
* "max" - the highest value for the date period.
* "min" - the lowest value for the date period.
* "sum" - the sum of all values for the date period. Defaults to 0 if no data points are defined.
* "sumOrNull" - the sum of all values for the date period. Defaults to `null` if no data points are defined.
* "first" - the first value
* function(values, series, dataItems, category) - user-defined aggregate function. Returns single value or data item.
* object  - (compound aggregate) **Applicable to "candlestick", "boxPlot"  and ohlc "series"**. Specifies the aggregate for each data item field.

##### Example - set the chart series aggregate

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      categoryAxis: {
        categories: [
          new Date("2012/01/01"),
          new Date("2012/01/02"),
          new Date("2012/01/02")
        ],
        type: "date"
      },
      series: [{
          data: [1, 2, 3],
          aggregate: "avg"
      }]
    });
    </script>

##### Example - set the chart series aggregate using a function

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      categoryAxis: {
        categories: [
          new Date("2012/01/01"),
          new Date("2012/01/02"),
          new Date("2012/01/02")
        ],
        type: "date"
      },
      series: [{
          data: [1, 2, 3],
          aggregate: function(values, series, dataItems, category) {
            // Two values with the same date(2 and 3), add them together and then divide them by the total number of values with the same category.
            let average = values.reduce((a, b) => a + b) / values.length;

            return average;
          }
      }]
    });
    </script>

### series.autoFit `Boolean` *(default: false)*

If set to true, the Chart automatically scales down to fit the content area. Applicable for the Pie and Donut series.

> The `autoFit` option is supported when [series.type](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-series.type) is set to "pie" or "donut".


<div class="meta-api-description">
Adjust or enable automatic resizing and scaling for pie or donut chart series to ensure slices, labels, and segments fit neatly within the chart’s visible area, preventing overflow, clipping, or hidden parts by dynamically shrinking the drawing space. Configure the chart to automatically adapt its dimensions for pie and donut slices, optimizing layout and visibility by controlling slice fit, scaling behavior, size adjustment, overflow prevention, and label containment within the component boundaries. This feature handles automatic dimension control, slice fitting, and layout adaptation for circular chart elements to maintain complete slice and label visibility without manual resizing.
</div>

#### Example - set the chart series autoFit

    var data = [{
      kind: 'Solar', share: 0.052
    }, {

    }, {
      kind: 'Other', share: 0.192
    }, {
      kind: 'Hydroelectric', share: 0.175
    }, {
      kind: 'Nuclear', share: 0.238
    }, {
      kind: 'Coal', share: 0.118
    }];

    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      dataSource: { data: data },

### series.data `Array`

The array of data items which represent the series data.

Can be set to :

* Array of objects. Each point is bound to the field specified via the [series.field](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-series.field) option.
* Array of numbers. Supported when the [series.type](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-series.type) option is set to "area", "bar", "column", "donut", "pie", "line" or "waterfall".
* Array of arrays of numbers. Supported when the [series.type](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-series.type) option is set to "bubble", "scatter", "scatterLine", "ohlc", "rangeBar", "rangeArea" or polar series.
    * Bubble series need arrays of three values - X value, Y value and Size value e.g. `[1, 1, 10]`
    * Scatter and scatter line series need arrays of two values - X value and Y value
    * OHLC and candlestick series need arrays of four values - open, high, low and close
    * RangeBar and RangeArea series need arrays of two values - the from and to value.


<div class="meta-api-description">
Set or configure the data points for a chart series using arrays of objects mapped to fields or numeric arrays and tuples tailored to various series types like area, bar, column, donut, pie, line, waterfall, bubble, scatter, scatterLine, OHLC, rangeBar, rangeArea, or polar. Enable binding individual points to object properties, provide simple number lists for basic charts, or specify complex coordinate sets including XY pairs for scatter plots, triplets with size dimensions for bubble charts, quadruple values representing open-high-low-close data for financial OHLC or candlestick series, and from-to ranges for range bars and areas. Control how data arrays reflect the series type’s requirements, such as mapping fields for categorical data or supplying numeric tuples for spatial and temporal charting, supporting diverse visualization needs including bubbles, ranges, and polar coordinates. Key search intents include configuring series data arrays, binding data points to object fields, setting numeric arrays or tuples matching series types, handling charts with multiple dimensions like XYZ or OHLC, mapping from-to ranges, and controlling complex data input formats for various chart series.
</div>

      $("#chart").kendoChart({

### series.drilldownSeriesFactory `Function`

A function that creates the drilldown series for a given point.

The function should accept a single parameter, the point `drilldownField` value.
The function should return a series configuration object or a `Promise` that resolves to one.

**Important** - The function must return exactly one series object. Returning an array of series is not supported.

<div class="meta-api-description">
Configure dynamic drill down functionality for charts by defining a factory function that generates or retrieves detailed series data when users interact with specific data points, enabling customized or asynchronous loading of series configurations based on the drilldown key or field associated with the selected point, supporting both synchronous returns of series options and promises for fetching or constructing series definitions on demand to enhance interactive data exploration and layered visualization.
</div>

#### Example - use the chart series drilldownSeriesFactory function to implement dynamic drilldown

    <nav id="breadcrumb"></nav>
    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
      var vehiclesByModel = {
        'Tesla': [{
          model: 'Model 3',
          count: 225350
        }, {
          model: 'Model Y',
          count: 40159
        }],
        'VW': [{
          model: 'ID.3',
          count: 60274
        }, {
          model: 'ID.4',
          count: 20302
        }]
      };

      var vehiclesByMake = [{
        company: 'Tesla',
        count: 314159
      }, {
        company: 'VW',
        count: 112645
      }];

      function drilldownByModel(make) {
        const data = vehiclesByModel[make];
        if (data) {
          return {
            type: 'column',
            name: make + ' Sales by Model',
            data,
            field: 'count',
            categoryField: 'model'
          };
        }
      };

      $("#chart").kendoChart({
        series: [{
          type: 'column',
          name: 'Battery EVs registered in 2022',
          data: vehiclesByMake,
          field: 'count',
          categoryField: 'company',
          drilldownField: 'company',
          drilldownSeriesFactory: drilldownByModel
        }]
      });

      $('#breadcrumb').kendoChartBreadcrumb({
        chart: "#chart"
      });
    </script>

### series.summaryField `String` *(default: "summary")*

The data item field which contains the summary type for [waterfall](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-series.type) series.
Summary columns are optional and can be one of two types:

* "runningTotal" - Displays the sum of all items since the last "runningTotal" point.
* "total" - Displays the sum of all previous items.

> The value, if any, of a data item marked as a summary point will be discarded.


<div class="meta-api-description">
Configure the field used to identify summary types within chart series data, enabling control over waterfall or cumulative charts by marking specific data points as summary or total steps instead of numeric values. This setup allows defining running totals, grand totals, or intermediate summary points that aggregate previous values dynamically, influencing how the series renders cumulative or subtotal columns and managing how data transitions between regular values and calculated summaries. Adjust and set which data column dictates the type of summary calculation to control the visualization of running sums, totals, or aggregated data points in complex series representations.
</div>

#### Example

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      series: [{
        type: "waterfall",
        data: [{
            value: 100
        }, {
            value: -20
        }, {
            type: "runningTotal"
        }, {
            value: 50
        }, {
            type: "total"
        }]
      }]
    });
    </script>

### series.neckRatio `Number` *(default: 0.3)*

`neckRatio` specifies the ratio top-base/bottom-base of the whole chart. neckRatio set to three means the top base is three times smaller than the bottom base.

> The `neckRatio` option is supported when [series.type](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-series.type) is set to "funnel" and dynamicSlope set to `false`.


<div class="meta-api-description">
Control the shape and proportions of funnel charts by configuring the ratio between the funnel's narrow top section and wider bottom base, enabling adjustments to how slim or wide the funnel neck appears relative to its base; modify the neck width ratio to customize the tapering effect, fine-tune the funnel's visual emphasis, set precise neck-to-base width proportions for better data representation, and manage the funnel segment scaling when dynamic slope adjustments are disabled and funnel type is selected.
</div>

#### Example - set the chart series neckRatio field

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      series: [
        {
          type: "funnel",
          neckRatio: 0.1, //bottom base becomes 10 times smaller than the bottom one
          data: [
            { value: 1 },
            { value: 2 },
            { value: 3 }
          ]
        }
      ]
    });
    </script>

### series.dynamicSlope `Boolean` *(default: false)*

> The `dynamicSlope` option is supported when [series.type](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-series.type) is set to "funnel".

When set to true the ratio of the bases of each segment is calculated based on the ratio of currentDataItem.value/nextDataItem.value
The last element is always created like a rectangle since there is no following element.



<div class="meta-api-description">
Enable variable funnel segment angles or slopes to make each funnel section’s base width adjust dynamically according to the ratio between consecutive data values, allowing funnel charts to visually represent proportional relationships between segments. Control dynamic slope behavior in funnel series so adjacent segments scale their widths relative to following data points, supporting visual comparison of data trends, ratios, or value changes across funnel stages. Configure funnel charts to use data-driven segment bases instead of uniform widths, enhancing representation of sequential values, weighted distributions, or progressive ratios within funnel visualization components.
</div>

#### Example - set the chart series dynamicSlope field

      series: [
        {
          type: "funnel",
          dynamicSlope: true,

          ]

      ]
    });
    </script>

### series.dynamicHeight `Boolean` *(default: true)*

> The `dynamicHeight` option is supported when [series.type](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-series.type) is set to "funnel" or "pyramid".

### series.errorBars.value `String|Number|Array|Function`

The error bars value.

> The `value` option is supported when [series.type](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-series.type) is set to "bar", "column", "line" or "area".

The following value types are supported:

* "stderr" - the [standard error](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Standard_error) of the series values will be used to calculate the point low and high value
* "stddev(n)" - the [standard deviation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Standard_deviation) of the series values will be used to calculate the point low and high value. A number can be specified between the parentheses, that will be multiplied by the calculated standard deviation.
* "percentage(n)" - a percentage of the point value
* A number that will be subtracted/added to the point value
* An array that holds the low and high difference from the point value
* A function that returns the errorBars point value


<div class="meta-api-description">
Adjust error bar calculations for chart series by configuring how low and high points are derived using statistical options like standard error, standard deviation with adjustable multipliers, percentage-based offsets, fixed numeric offsets, custom arrays specifying ranges, or user-defined callback functions. Customize error ranges for bar, column, line, or area charts by setting error bars to compute variability, uncertainty, or confidence intervals dynamically through percentage values, fixed shifts, standard statistical measures, or fully customizable logic to represent data variability, measurement error, or tolerance levels in visual data representations.
</div>

#### Example - set the error bars value to a percentage of the point value

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      series: [{
        type: "column",
        data: [4.743, 7.295, 7.175, 6.376],
        errorBars: {
          value: "percentage(20)"
        }
      }]
    });
    </script>

#### Example - set the error bars value to a half of the series standard deviation

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>

      series: [{
        type: "column",
        data: [4.743, 7.295, 7.175, 6.376],
        errorBars: {
          value: "stddev(0.5)"
        }
      }]
    });
    </script>

### series.errorBars.visual `Function`

A function that can be used to create a custom visual for the error bars. The available argument fields are:

* rect - the `kendo.geometry.Rect` that defines where the visual should be rendered.
* options - the error bar options.
* createVisual - a function that can be used to get the default visual.
* low - the error bar low value.
* high - the error bar high value.
* sender - the chart instance.


<div class="meta-api-description">
Customize error bar appearance by defining a visual rendering function to override or extend default error bar styles and drawing in chart series, enabling control over error bar shape, positioning, colors, and graphics; configure or replace the standard error bar visuals using parameters like geometric boundaries, error range values, chart instance context, and default visual generators, allowing precise tailoring of error bar displays, styling overrides, and custom graphics integration within chart series error indicators.
</div>

#### Example - use custom visual for the error bars

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
      $("#chart").kendoChart({
        series: [{
          data: [4.743, 7.295, 7.175, 6.376],
          errorBars: {
            value: "stddev(0.5)",
            visual: function (e) {
              return kendo.drawing.Path.fromRect(e.rect, {
                fill: {
                  color: e.options.color
                }
              });
            }
          }
        }]
      });
    </script>

### series.trendline.order `Number` *(default: 2)*

The order (degree) of the Polynomial trendline. The default value is 2.

> The period setting is supported only when [series.type](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-series.type) is set to "polynomialTrendline".

Accepted values are from 2 to 6:
* 2: a Quadratic polynomial trendline with a single extreme point (minimum or maximum) point.
* 3: a Cubic polynomial trendline with up to 2 extreme points.
* 4: a polynomial trendline of 4th degree with up to 3 extreme points.
* 5: a polynomial trendline of 5th degree with up to 4 extreme points.
* 6: a polynomial trendline of 6th degree with up to 5 extreme points.


<div class="meta-api-description">
Adjust the polynomial degree or order of a trendline on a chart series to shape the curve complexity and control the number of peaks, troughs, or turning points, setting values typically between 2 and 6 for quadratic to sixth-degree polynomial fitting. Configure the trendline order to influence how many extreme points or inflection points the smoothing function has, enabling fine-tuning of data approximation with quadratic, cubic, quartic, quintic, or sextic polynomial trends. Control the smoothness, curvature, and fit precision of polynomial trendlines by setting the order level to increase the curve’s flexibility for better modeling of data patterns and fluctuations, useful in trend analysis, forecasting, and statistical data visualization for series flagged as polynomial. Enable setting polynomial trendline complexity in charts to adjust the degree of approximation, balancing underfitting and overfitting by selecting the number of polynomial terms influencing the curve shape and number of maxima and minima represented in the data line.
</div>

> The `opacity` option is supported when [series.type](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-series.type) is set to "bubble", "pie" or "donut".


<div class="meta-api-description">
Adjust or configure the transparency level, alpha, or opacity of highlighted or emphasized chart data points in bubble, pie, or donut series to control how visible or subtle selected, hovered, or focused elements appear during user interaction, enabling you to fine-tune the prominence, brightness, or intensity of highlighted segments or bubbles with custom transparency settings for better visual emphasis or subtlety in data visualization.
</div>

#### Example - set the highlight opacity

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      series: [{
          type: "pie",
          data: [1, 2],
          highlight: {
            opacity: 0.5
          }
      }]
    });
    </script>

### series.highlight.toggle `Function`

A function that can be used to handle toggling the points highlight. The available argument fields are:

* preventDefault - a function that can be used to prevent showing the default highlight overlay.
* show - a boolean value indicating whether the highlight should be shown.
* visual - the visual element that should be highlighted.
* category - the point category.
* dataItem - the point dataItem.
* value - the point value.
* series - the point series.


<div class="meta-api-description">
Control, customize, or disable the visual toggling of data point highlights in charts by configuring handlers that respond when highlights are shown or hidden, enabling inspection and conditional logic based on point attributes such as category, value, series, data item, and rendered visuals; support use cases for enabling or preventing default highlight overlays, dynamically adjusting highlight behavior, intercepting highlight events for custom visual effects, managing highlight state changes, and accessing detailed context during highlight toggle actions.
</div>

#### Example - using custom highlight

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
      $("#chart").kendoChart({
        series: [{
          type: "pie",
          data: [1, 2],
          highlight: {
            toggle: function (e) {
              e.preventDefault();

              var opacity = e.show ? 0.5 : 1;
              e.visual.opacity(opacity);
            }
          }
        }]
      });
    </script>

### series.highlight.visible `Boolean` *(default: true)*

If set to `true` the chart will highlight the series when the user hovers it with the mouse.
By default chart series highlighting is enabled.


<div class="meta-api-description">
Control whether the chart series visually emphasizes or highlights when hovering over it with a mouse pointer, enabling or disabling interactive focus and emphasis effects on data series to improve visibility and user engagement, with options to turn on or off the highlight feature during mouseover events for better chart readability and user interface feedback.
</div>

#### Example - prevent the chart series highlighting

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      series: [{
          type: "pie",
          data: [1, 2],
          highlight: {
            visible: false
          }
      }]
    });
    </script>

### series.highlight.visual `Function`

A function that can be used to set custom visual for the point highlight.

The available argument fields are:

* createVisual - a function that can be used to get the default highlight visual.
* rect - the `kendo.geometry.Rect` that defines where the visual should be rendered.
* visual - the visual element that should be highlighted.
* options - the point options.
* category - the point category.
* dataItem - the point dataItem.
* value - the point value.
* sender - the chart instance.
* series - the point series.
* stackValue - the cumulative point value on the stack. Available only for stackable series.
* percentage - the point value represented as a percentage value. Available only for donut, pie and 100% stacked charts.
* runningTotal - the sum of point values since the last "runningTotal" [summary point](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-series.summaryField). Available for waterfall series.
* total - the sum of all previous series values. Available for waterfall series.
* from - the "from" point highlight visual options. Available for "rangeArea" and "verticalRangeArea" series.
* to - the "to" point highlight visual options. Available for "rangeArea" and "verticalRangeArea" series.


<div class="meta-api-description">
Customize or override the default point highlight visual in chart series by defining custom shapes, effects, or annotations for highlighted data points, enabling control over how specific points are emphasized with tailored visuals. Configure highlight appearance for various chart types—including stacked, donut, pie, waterfall, rangeArea, and verticalRangeArea—by accessing data point properties such as value, category, percentage, running total, and cumulative stack values, as well as the chart instance and series context. Enable drawing custom graphics at precise locations using the rendering rectangle, access default visual elements to modify or augment them, and control point highlight styling dynamically based on the underlying data item, series attributes, or chart state to create rich, context-aware point emphasis in data visualizations.
</div>

#### Example - use custom highlight visual

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
      $("#chart").kendoChart({
        series: [ {
          type: "area",
          data: [1, 2, 3],
          highlight: {
            visual: function(e) {
              var center = e.rect.center();
              var circleGeometry = new kendo.geometry.Circle(center, 10);
              var circle = new kendo.drawing.Circle(circleGeometry, {
                fill: {
                  color: "red"
                }
              });
              return circle;
            }
          }
        }]
      });
    </script>

<div class="meta-api-description">
Configure, control, and customize chart series label content, appearance, and placement, including setting label visibility, binding label text to data fields, applying numeric, date, or custom formatting, positioning labels within or outside the series, using templates for dynamic or complex label content, styling fonts, colors, and other visuals, and managing label rendering options to enhance chart readability, clarity, and presentation according to developer needs and visualization scenarios.

### series.labels.align `String`

The label alignment when [series.type](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-series.type) is set to "donut", "funnel", "pyramid" or "pie".

The supported values  for "donut" and "pie" are:

* "circle" - the labels are positioned in circle around the chart.
* "column" - the labels are positioned in columns to the left and right of the chart.

The supported values for "funnel" and "pyramid" are:

* "center" - the labels are positioned in the center over the segment.
* "right" - the labels are positioned on the right side of the chart and do not (if there is enough space) overlap the segment(s).
* "left" - the labels are positioned on the left side of the chart and do not (if there is enough space) overlap the segment(s).



<div class="meta-api-description">
Configure label positioning and alignment for donut, funnel, pyramid, and pie chart series to control whether labels appear inside segments, around the chart in a circular layout, or arranged in columns or side-aligned positions. Enable setting labels to circle the chart perimeter or stack in columns left and right for donut and pie charts, or align labels center, left, or right relative to funnel and pyramid segments, ensuring label placement avoids overlap and matches desired visual layout. Adjust label alignment to place annotations inside segments or alongside them on specified chart sides to optimize readability and presentation for different chart types.
</div>

#### Example - set the chart series label alignment
    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      series: [ {
        labels: {
          visible: true,
          align: "column"
        },
        type: "pie",
        data: [1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6]
      }]
    });
    </script>

### series.labels.ariaTemplate `String | Function`

The [template](/api/framework/kendo#methods-template) which renders the ARIA label for the series labels.

The fields which can be used in the template are:

*   category - the category name. Available for area, bar, column, bubble, donut, line and pie series.
*   dataItem - the original data item used to construct the point. Will be null if binding to array.
*   percentage - the point value represented as a percentage value. Available only for 100% stacked charts.
*   series - the data series
*   value - the point value. Can be a number or object containing each bound field.


<div class="meta-api-description">
Customize and configure accessible ARIA labels for chart series data points using dynamic templates that generate descriptive screen reader text for series labels, enabling clearer narration of chart categories, data items, series details, point values, and percentages in stacked charts, supporting multiple chart types like area, bar, column, bubble, donut, line, and pie, with flexible template fields to set, control, or define how values and categories are announced by assistive technologies.
</div>

#### Example

```pseudo
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
         title: {
             text: "My Chart Title"
         },
         series: [
             {
                 type: "area",
                 name: "Series 1",
                 data: [200, 450, 300, 125],
                 labels: {
                     template: "#= value #%",
                     ariaTemplate: "The value for #= series.name # in #= category # is #= value #",
                     visible: true
                 }
             }
         ],
         categoryAxis: {
             categories: [2000, 2001, 2002, 2003]
         }
    });
```

### series.labels.format `String|Function` *(default: "{0}")*

The format of the labels. Uses [kendo.format](/api/javascript/kendo/methods/format).

Format placeholders:

* Area, bar, column, line, pie, radarArea, radarColumn and radarLine
    *   {0} - value
* Bubble
    *   {0} - x value
    *   {1} - y value
    *   {2} - size value
    *   {3} - category name
* Bullet
    *   {0} - value
    *   {1} - target value
* Scatter, scatterLine
    *   {0} - x value
    *   {1} - y value
* PolarArea, polarLine and polarScatter
    *   {0} - x value (degrees)
    *   {1} - y value
* Candlestick and OHLC
    *   {0} - open value
    *   {1} - high value
    *   {2} - low value
    *   {3} - close value
    *   {4} - category name
* RangeArea, rangeBar, rangeColumn
    *   {0} - from value
    *   {1} - to value


<div class="meta-api-description">
Control and customize how chart series labels display values, dates, categories, or coordinates by configuring formatted strings that use Kendo format patterns for precise label text styling, enabling you to format numeric, date/time, categorical, or coordinate data across different chart types such as area, bar, column, line, pie, radar, bubble, bullet, scatter, polar, candlestick, OHLC, and range charts. Enable setting label output with placeholders for values, x and y coordinates, sizes, targets, open/high/low/close prices, or range boundaries, allowing developers to tailor label content by specifying format strings that convert raw data points into readable, localized, and context-aware labels for visual analytics, data visualization customization, tooltip enhancements, and presentation consistency in interactive charts.
</div>

### series.labels.position `String|Function`

The position of the labels.

* "above" - the label is positioned at the top of the marker. **Applicable for series that render points, incl. bubble.**
* "below" - the label is positioned at the bottom of the marker. **Applicable for series that render points, incl. bubble.**
* "center" - the label is positioned at the point center. **Applicable for bar, column, donut, pie, funnel, pyramid, radarColumn and waterfall series.**
* "insideBase" - the label is positioned inside, near the base of the bar. **Applicable for bar, column and waterfall series.**
* "insideEnd" - the label is positioned inside, near the end of the point. **Applicable for bar, column, donut, pie, radarColumn and waterfall series.**
* "left" - the label is positioned to the left of the marker. **Applicable for series that render points, incl. bubble.**
* "outsideEnd" - the label is positioned outside, near the end of the point. **Applicable for bar, column, donut, pie, radarColumn and waterfall series. Not applicable for stacked series.**
* "right" - the label is positioned to the right of the marker. **Applicable for series that render points, incl. bubble.**
* "top" - the label is positioned at the top of the segment. **Applicable for funnel series.**
* "bottom" - the label is positioned at the bottom of the segment. **Applicable for funnel and pyramid series.**
* "auto" - the from and to labels area positioned at the top/bottom(rangeArea series) or left/right(verticalRangeArea series) so that they are outside the filled area. **Applicable for rangeArea and verticalRangeArea series.**



<div class="meta-api-description">
Set, configure, or control the placement and alignment of data labels in chart series relative to points, markers, bars, columns, segments, or shapes, enabling positioning options such as above, below, left, right, centered, inside near the base or end, outside at the end, top, bottom, or automatic placement based on series type; supports diverse chart types including bar, column, pie, donut, funnel, pyramid, radarColumn, waterfall, bubble, rangeArea, and verticalRangeArea, ensuring labels can be aligned inside or outside graphical elements for clarity in different visualization scenarios and enabling customization of label orientation and location for stacked or unstacked data points or ranges across various chart series configurations.
</div>

### series.labels.template `String|Function`

The [template](/api/javascript/kendo/methods/template) which renders the chart series label.

The fields which can be used in the template are:

* category - the category name. Available for area, bar, column, bubble, donut, line, pie and waterfall series.
* dataItem - the original data item used to construct the point. Will be null if binding to array.
* percentage - the point value represented as a percentage value. Available only for donut, pie and 100% stacked charts.
* series - the data series
* stackValue - the cumulative point value on the stack. Available only for stackable series.
* value - the point value. Can be a number or object containing each bound field.
* runningTotal - the sum of point values since the last "runningTotal" [summary point](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-series.summaryField). Available for waterfall series.
* total - the sum of all previous series values. Available for waterfall series.

> The text can be split into multiple lines by using line feed characters ("\n").


<div class="meta-api-description">
Control and customize chart series labels by configuring text templates that dynamically format and render label content with data-bound values like category names, raw data points, numerical values, percentages, stack totals, running totals, and overall sums. Enable flexible label composition for various chart types including area, bar, column, bubble, donut, line, pie, waterfall, and stacked series by setting up templated text that can embed multiple data fields such as category, data item, point value, series information, percentage share, cumulative stack values, running totals, and aggregate totals, supporting multiline labels through newline characters. This empowers formatting, data-driven label generation, and customization for descriptive, meaningful annotations across diverse chart visualizations.
</div>

#### Example - set the chart series label template

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      series: [ {
        labels: {
          visible: true,
          template: "Value: #: value #%"

      }]
    });
    </script>

### series.labels.visual `Function`

A function that can be used to create a custom visual for the labels. The available argument fields are:

* text - the label text.
* rect - the `kendo.geometry.Rect` that defines where the visual should be rendered.
* options - the label options.
* createVisual - a function that can be used to get the default visual.
* sender - the chart instance (may be undefined).
* value - The point value.
* category - The point category.
* stackValue - The cumulative point value on the stack. Available only for the stackable series.
* dataItem - The point dataItem.
* series - The point series.
* percentage - The point value that is represented as a percentage value. Available only for the Donut, Pie, and 100% stacked charts.
* runningTotal - The sum of point values from the last runningTotal summary point onwards. Available for the Waterfall series.
* total - The sum of all previous series values. Available for the Waterfall series.


<div class="meta-api-description">
Customize and control the rendering of series data point labels by providing a callback or handler that generates tailored visuals for each label, enabling developers to set, modify, or replace default label graphics based on criteria like label text, position coordinates, chart area, data values, categories, series metadata, cumulative stacking values, percentage contributions in pie or donut charts, running totals in waterfall charts, and original data items, supporting use cases such as dynamic label styling, conditional formatting, complex graphic overlays, interactive or animated label content, and precise visual adjustments to enhance chart readability and user experience.
</div>

#### Example - using custom visual for the labels

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
      $("#chart").kendoChart({
        series: [ {
          labels: {
            visible: true,
            visual: function(e) {
              var center = e.rect.center();
              return new kendo.drawing.Text(e.text, [center.x, e.rect.origin.y], {
                fill: {
                  color: "red"
                }
              });
            }
          },
          data: [1, 2, 3]
        }]
      });
    </script>

### series.legendItem.markers.visual `Function`

A function that can be used to create a custom visual for the markers. The available argument fields are:

* rect - the `kendo.geometry.Rect` that defines where the visual should be rendered.
* options - the marker options.
* createVisual - a function that can be used to get the default visual.
* category - the category of the marker point.
* dataItem - the dataItem of the marker point.
* value - the value of the marker point.
* sender - the chart instance.
* series - the series of the marker point.


<div class="meta-api-description">
Customize or override default chart legend markers by creating tailored visuals that can be bound dynamically to data points, categories, values, or series, enabling developers to control, configure, or design unique marker graphics for easier data representation, styling, or branding, while accessing contextual information such as rendering dimensions, chart instances, marker options, and default visual creation methods to enhance or replace standard legend marker rendering within various chart series.
</div>

#### Example - use custom visual for the markers

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
      $("#chart").kendoChart({
        series: [{
          type: "line",
          name: "Series A",
          data: [1, 2, 3],
          legendItem: {
            markers: {
              visual: function (e) {
                var origin = e.rect.origin;
                var center = e.rect.center();
                var bottomRight = e.rect.bottomRight();

                var path = new kendo.drawing.Path({
                  fill: {
                    color: e.options.border.color
                  }
                })
                .moveTo(origin.x, bottomRight.y)
                .lineTo(bottomRight.x, bottomRight.y)
                .lineTo(center.x, origin.y)
                .close();

                return path;
              }
            }
          }
        }]
      });
    </script>

A function that can be used to create a custom visual for the legend items. The available argument fields are:

- `createVisual`&mdash;A function for getting the default visual.
- `series`&mdash;The item series.
- `pointIndex`&mdash;The index of the point in the series. Available for the Pie, Donut, and Funnel series.


<div class="meta-api-description">
Customize or override chart legend item markers and labels by defining a function that controls or replaces the default visual elements, enabling developers to create tailored legend indicators, style series legend entries differently, modify or extend standard legend graphics, generate new visuals for specific data points, integrate custom rendering logic for pie, donut, or funnel chart legends, dynamically adjust legend icons based on series or point index, and manipulate or enhance legend display beyond default rendering behavior.
</div>

#### Example - using custom visual for the legend items

    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
      $("#chart").kendoChart({
        series: [
          {
            name: "Series 1",
            data: [1, 2, 3],
            legendItem: {
              visual: function (e) {
                var color = e.options.markers.background;
                var labelColor = e.options.labels.color;
                var rect = new kendo.geometry.Rect([0, 0], [100, 50]);
                var layout = new kendo.drawing.Layout(rect, {
                  spacing: 5,
                  alignItems: "center"
                });

                var marker = new kendo.drawing.Path({
                  fill: {
                    color: color
                  }
                }).moveTo(10, 0).lineTo(15, 10).lineTo(5, 10).close();

                var label = new kendo.drawing.Text(e.series.name, [0, 0], {
                  fill: {
                    color: labelColor
                  }
                });

                layout.append(marker, label);
                layout.reflow()

                return layout;
              }
            }
          }
        ]
      });
    </script>

### series.missingValues `String`

The behavior for handling missing values. The supported values are:

* "gap" - the plot stops before the missing point and continues after it.
* "interpolate" - the value is interpolated from neighboring points.
* "zero" - the value is assumed to be zero.

> The default value is "interpolate", except for "area" and stacked series which default to "zero".

> The `missingValues` option is supported when [series.type](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-series.type) is set to "area", "rangeArea", "line", "scatterLine", "radarLine", "radarArea", "polarLine" or "polarArea".


<div class="meta-api-description">
Adjust how charts handle missing, null, or undefined data points within series by choosing whether to display gaps where data is absent, interpolate missing values based on neighboring points to create smooth transitions, or assign zeros to fill empty spots. Configure line, area, radar, polar, and scatter series to treat missing entries as gaps that break the plot, smoothly estimate values through interpolation between adjacent points, or replace missing data with zero values to maintain continuous visualizations. Control data completeness in visualizations by setting missing data behavior to gap, interpolate, or zero, enabling options to handle null, empty, or incomplete datasets dynamically for accurate representation in line, area, range, radar, and polar charts. Set how absent or null points affect chart rendering, including using zero-filling to avoid breaks, interpolating nearby points for smooth curves, or showing visible gaps, applicable to series types like area, line, scatter, radar, and polar formats. Manage missing or incomplete time series data in charts by specifying whether to leave gaps for missing entries, estimate missing measurements by interpolation, or treat missing points as zeros to influence data continuity and visual output.
</div>

#### Example - set the missing values behavior
    <div id="chart"></div>
    <script>
    $("#chart").kendoChart({
      series: [{
        type: "line",
        missingValues: "gap",
        data: [1, 3, null, 4, 5]
      }]
    });
    </script>

### series.style `String` *(default: "normal")*

The supported values are:

* "normal" - The values will be connected with straight line.
* "step" - The values will be connected with a line with right angle.
* "smooth" - The values will be connected with a smooth line.

> The default value is "normal".

> The `style` option is supported when [series.type](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-series.type) is set to "line", "scatterLine", "radarLine" or "polarLine".

> The `step` value is only supported when [series.type](/api/javascript/dataviz/ui/chart#configuration-series.type) is set to "line".

> The `smooth` options is not supported for stacked area series with missing values.

    <div id="chart"></div>

The type of stack to plot. The following types are supported:
